text: It slices through a canyon of tall buildings. Hardly any traffic at this time, just heavy haulers. A gasoline tanker, a car carrier, a flatbed with a huge bulldozer.
A BIG RIG. The Peterbuilt tractor pulls a nondescript whi container with Japanese export seals on its padlocks.

HUMMING to country music, a TRUCKER rubs weary eyes and checks the clock: 4:00AM. He reaches for a thermos. RAGE AGAINST THE MACHINE BLARES somewhere behind him. Startled, his coffee spills. He peers into his mirror.
He squints, lifts an arm for shade. He HEARS a performanc engine ROAR, its turbo SQUEALING. Looks out the window.
He glimpses his own reflection in the glistening hood of black on black Honda Civic built for speed. It takes off the freeway and is gone, just like that.

More HEADLIGHTS. Blinding. VROOM! VROOM! VROOM! Three more tricked Civics appear like rockets, CRISS-CROSSING in front of the truck. The little black cars cavort playfully around the semis a they zoom up the freeway. Fading in the distance.
Sucks air through his teeth, unamused by the deadly antic
Stupid damn kids. EXT. 110 FREEWAY - NIGHT ° Our Big Rig passes an on-ramp. From which...
Suddenly appear. Their engines, music SCREAMING. They box in the Big Rig as it enters a long tunnel.  Blue Revision 05/05/2000 2.

The Trucker watches in disbelief as the sunroof of the le car opens and a BANDIT emerges wearing an odd helmet and mask. He raises a speargun. With a finger, the Trucker stabs the EMERGENCY button on CB radio.
I'm being jacked! I-5 North at the 110 interchange! STATIC. There is no signal in the tunnel.

The Bandit shoulders the speargun. Aims at the Big Rig. THWACK-DINK! A spear pierces windshield. Barbs extend, anchoring it. The Bandit clips the spear's cable to the rollcage. The Driver punches the gas. The cable pulls taught and the windshield is yanked from its frame. It SHATTERS against the highway. The Bandit unclips the cable from the rollcage. He loads another spear into the gun. THWACK-DUNK! The spear slams into the seat next to the Driver. This time the cable clipped to the arrow leads to... The Bandit, climbing out the sunroof, revealing a cable r on his chest. He rides the Civic like an insane surfer. He pulls the pin of a chemical grenade in his hand. It smokes furiously. The Bandit leaps into space... hits a button -- the winch his chest RATCHETS him to the Big Rig. The Bandit bounces against the grill. INT. BIG RIG (MOVING) - NIGHT ” Trucker watches the Bandit hurl the HISSING canister thro the missing windshield. White smoke fills the cab. The Trucker slumps. The Big Rig SWERVES WILDLY. The trailer whips right... left... (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 3.
Nearly jackknifes. The Bandit climbs across the hood, int the cab. About to smash into the...

He maneuvers into the driver's seat. He works the wheel a gears with skill. The Big Rig pulls away from the wall, straightens out, accelerates. It exits the tunnel and cut a hard right toward an offramp. The Bandit gives the high sign. The little black cars fal in behind like ducklings. EXT. OFFRAMP — NIGHT The Big Rig moving too fast, outside tires SCREAMING, it threatens to tip, SCRAPING the steel safety rail.

A lone LAPD cruiser SCREECHES to a stop at the bottom of ramp. Two COPS get out, aim their 9's up the ramp. The Big Rig's engine HOWLS. Its AIRHORN blows in warning. The Two Cops trade looks, dive out of the way as... Whim The cruiser is smashed backwards into a bus stop shelter with a collision repair advertisement. The Rig barely manages the turn. Followed by the four Civics. : A Cop SCREAMS into his radio. SEES the Civics have no plates. TWO POLICE CRUISERS slide sideways onto the empty road, heavy duty V8's GROWLING. The Civics simultaneously scatter down four different sidestrokes. The two cruisers focus on the Big Rig, a good distance ahead. INT. BIG RIG (MOVING) - NIGHT ° It pulls off San Fernando, down a side street, heading fo the old warehouses along the L.A. River. The Big Rig SMASHES through a metal gate. Headlights hit a warehouse's wall -- finding large wooden doors as the Big Rig swerves. CRASHES through the doors.  10 12 13
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 4.
The Big Rig crosses the parking lot, heading for the L.A. River. It flattens a chainlink fence, crosses a service road, and punches through a second chainlink fence.
The Big Rig careens down an embankment. A HELICOPTER arrives and hits it with the Nightsun. The Big Rig rolls down the cement channel, precarious, out of control.
The shattered doors are now an ugly pile of wood. The cop car swerves, follows the side of the warehouse. Passes though flattened fence. Now cruising the service road.
It runs parallel to the river.

Zoom up the road, following the Big Rig in the riverbed below. To their amazement, it heads right for a forest of concrete columns supporting a large bridge. EXT. BRIDGE - NIGHT 13c The Big Rig COLLIDES with a huge unyielding column. The c is crumpled. No one could have survived.
Come rolling down the embankment.
A door opens. The stolen Big Rig emerges. .The door close CRANE through the Big Rig's exhaust into: INT. WAREHOUSE - NIGHT 14a The Trucker is passed out on a pile of scrap cardboard.
A COP approaches the smashed cab, gun drawn. He pulls at the crumbled door. A BODY falls out --- Not a body, a CPR dummy. The Cop peers in the cab, SEES a cinderblock on th gas’ pedal.
Shines his light inside the open doors of the shipping container -- It's empty.

A high-tech beast, its engine GRUMBLES angrily. At the wheel is BRIAN, early 20's, good looking, athletic, a gol boy. He plays his intense eyes over a bank of gauges and readouts. Pure confidence as he flips switches, He presses buttons on the turbo control. The readout BEEP counts down from 10. He opens a door atop the gearshift, exposing a red button. Brian leans forward, expectant.
Ten second quarter mile... Orange cones ahead mark the finish.
An empty concrete sea. The bright green Supra with Arizon plates is poised to pounce, a massive intercooler replaci the front bumper.

2... 1... Zero. Brian stomps the gas, hits the little red button. The engine SCREAMS. The turbine HOWLS. 1st gear, clutch up. The rear tires spin, smoke. The Supra shimmies a beat, then... . ° VROOM! The car rockets forward. Brian shifts, 2nd gear, struggling for control, fishtailing. 3rd gear. The car hits 9O0MPH. ‘Then, the front end begins to float then... Brian misfits, Gears GRIND. The car spins out, corkscrewing across the parking lot. The world outside rotates a few times. The car stops. The engine BACKFIRES and stalls. (CONTINUED)
18 19 20 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 6. CONTINUED: ‘ 18 Frustrated, Brian sighs, sits in silence a beat. This car scares him and that passes him off. He checks his watch.
»..shit... He starts the car and cautiously pilots it to the exit.
A performance racing parts store. Brian's Supra pulls up. He gets out and crosses to the entrance,

It's a high tech, otherworldly gallery of exotic racing a performance parts; turbos, exhausts, rims. Gleaming gages and winking dash computers. HARRY, the proprietor, a tough older black guy, sits on a stool filling out shipping labels. The cuff of his Dickie has ridden above boot top to reveal a prosthetic leg. He looks up at Brian, gives him an angry stare.
What now? Brian rubs two fingers together -- Money. Harry crosses h arms.
I don't like you very much.
Don't have to like me. You just have to listen to me. Harry grudgingly hits the NO SALE key and gives Brian a twenty from the register.
I'm going over there. What do you want on your Sandwich?
They know. Good luck. Brian gives him a look and grabs Harry's keyring off the counter. Harry watches him cross and exit the front door.

A pick-up with HARRY'S PRO SHOP emblazoned on the door is parked under some shade trees. Brian sits behind the whee with the sports page. He's watching: TORETTO'S LUNCH COUNTER, a small sandwich shop a half blo away. A CUSTOMER exits. A lone FIGURE behind the counter.
Airbrushed race cars and submarine sandwiches on the wall all unbelievably lifelike. MIA TORETTO, Brian's age, slic a beefsteak. tomato with practiced precision. A stunner, looks up with warm eyes.
Harry's pick-up parks and Brian exits.
Brian enters, crosses to the counter and turns on the cha he seems entirely disingenuous and sincere.
Hi, Harry sent me. He said you know what he likes.
Corned beef on a french roll with extra mustard. Do you know what you like? A beat as Brian checks her out.
Probably isn't on the menu.
Probably not. But our sandwiches are good.
Gimme a sub with everything. Brian hands her the twenty. Looks at photos on the wall a she makes change.
Of race cars, track scenes, several feature DOUG TORETTO, square jawed racer posing with his race cars. (CONTINUED)
21 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 8. CONTINUED: ‘ 21 On the adjacent wall, there's a life size painting of Dou helmet underarm, a race winning smile. Brian nods at it.
Nice. Who painted it?
Me. Brian impressed. Mia beams.
Guess talent runs in your family. Mia looks at Brian. She knows what he's going to say next

How's a guy get a shot racing Dominic? Mia looks at him, disappointed he's like all the rest. Sh slaps the change in his hand. Mia begins making the order Brian looks at the coffee in Mia's mug. It ripples with vibration. Something is approaching. RUMBLING.
Four cars streak past the windows. Their turbos WHINE, waste gates HISS. Brian turns in time to see their dust. The NOISE fades.
That's what I'm talking about. When he turns back to Mia, she has a cagey little grin.
Where you from?
Tucson.
Desert dweller. You a 'neck?
No. I'mme. I'm my own thing.
One of a kind. Working for Harry? Brian nods: yes. Mia feels for him.
Bet he's busting your ass. (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 9.
Been there three days, I hope he's just testing me.

No, it won't let up. Brian sags with mock weariness. In B.G. Unnoticed to Bria and Mia, a bright yellow Civic glides to a silent powerle stop behind Harry's pick-up. INT. VINCE'S CIVIC - DAY 21a The driver, VINCE, is a tough costumer in a wife beater, shaved head peppered with fight scars. Tatted and ripped, Vince is an intimidator. His sidekick, JESSE, lanky and baby-faced, a wry instigator, types on a laptop plugged i the car's CPU.

Check it out, Vee. See this hole and peak? That's why your unloading in third. I lengthen injector pulse another millisec, tune the nos timer and you'll bust ten. Watch, I'll ask Harry. Vince SEES that it isn't Harry talking to Mia.
That ain't Harry.
Mia wraps two sandwiches in wax paper.
I'm sure you got big dreams and all, but racing in LA's for keeps. Brian is pure confidence.
You haven't seen my car.

Make sure you have good shoes. It's a long walk back to Arizona. Then she SEES Vince watching and becomes serious. Brian notes the change, follows her eyeline to the yellow Civic outside and REACTS. Mia hands him a takeout bag.
See you tonight. (CONTINUED)

No, you won't. As Brian crosses to exit, he looks back and exchanges smi with Mia.
Vince didn't like seeing that.
Wassup with this fool? Prettyboy's in there thinking he's racking up numbers.
If he's driving that truck, Harry's got him sweeping floors or something.
Then he should know. Gotta be punished for his ignorance.
Kick his ass. The look Vince gives Jesse says, "Good idea."

An iridescent blue Celica GT and a magenta Eclipse, with subtle yet trippy flower graphics, park across the street From the Celica emerges LEON, tall, half black, cocky. LETTY, exits her Eclipse, a cute young latina who gets he thrills from racing. They lean against their cars and tra knowing looks.

. (deadpans) ° Shoot him.

I'm not your bro.
Mia SEES what is going down, slams the TALK button on an intercom.
Dom, get over here. Vince is gonna kick some guy's ass.
DOMINIC TORETTO sits at a table eating a bowl of soup. Filthy, grease covered, he sits on newspaper. Studying a video of an illegal drag race. Engrossed, learning.
Brian doesn't want to fight Vince.
Be cool, man. Vince shoves Brian back a step.

Don't tell me what to do. I ain't your bitch-- --WHAM! Brian nails him with an uppercut, CLACKING Vince' teeth together. Vince throws a strong series of punches. Brian blocks wha he can, takes the rest. Waiting for an opening, Brian kic Vince's groin, kicks his knee, and tosses him to the grou in one reactive blitz. INT. TORETTO'S LUNCH COUNTER - DAY 25a Mia hits the intercom again.
Vince is getting his ass kicked!
That gets Dominic's attention. He gets up -- big guy. FOLLOW HIM through the back kitchen, through a curtain. A pistol tucked into the small of his back. (CONTINUED)

«shit... He hops the counter, one hand leaving a greasy print. The other grabbing the snubbed .38 in his belt.
Don't you shoot anyone!

Brian grinds his Sketcher on Vince's neck. Leon and Letty come running to Vince's aid. Dominic explodes from the sh --charges Brian and pistolwhips him. CRACK! Brian drops t the ground. Stunned, seeing stars. Blood trickles from behind his ear. Vince straggles to his feet.
You crazy, kicking his ass? I'm the only one who can kick his ass. Vince gives Dominic a wounded look.
He was in my face.
I'm in your face. Dominic and Brian trade strong-willed glares. Dominic giv Vince a nod, he grabs Brian's wallet. Opens it, shows Dominic.
Brian stands, woozy. Dominic takes the wallet from Vince.
Brian Earl Spiller. Serial killer name. He throws it back hard at Brian, who fumbles to catch it. (CONTINUED)

For Harry? No, I'll call him, You're fired. Don't come back. You do, you're stupid. Serious ass shit. Brian wipes trickling blood from his neck. Brian glances Mia. Who though unhappy for Brian, knows Dominic always triumphs. Brian thinks different. Fixes Dominic with a look, intense and hopeful.
Me and you, quarter mile. How about it? Dominic laughs. Vince, Jesse, Leon, Letty grin at Brian's expense; just another small town kid with big city dreams
Don't talk to me again. Brian frowns. Dominic crosses to the shop, herding Mia inside. Brian looks down, SEES the sandwiches have been crushed in the melee.
You owe me some food.

Hook him up, Mia. Dominic locks eyes with Brian. The intensity of his stare gives Brian a chill. Dominic enters the shop. Followed by Vince, and Leon. Let gives Brian a long hungry look, disappears inside. Jesse, last, gives Brian a haughty look.
You gotta earn the right to race the Dominator. . Brian SNARLS. Spooking Jesse.
Harry devouring a fresh sandwich as Brian ices his head. Harry is delighted Brian got his comeuppance. (CONTINUED)

You're messing with my business. Dominic pays my rent. He's my best customer, my best advertiser. Every time he races, bunch'a kids come in wanting what he's got. He called and wants me to fire you. Over there five minutes and got your head split. What are you gonna do now? Brian looks away. Purses his lips. Thinking.

Harry's pick-up cruises down the street, Brian behind the wheel, pensive. ‘ An UNMARKED with two plainclothes pulls up behind him. It whoops the SIREN. Red and blues flashing behind the grill Brian REACTS. Pulls over. The driver exits, this is SERGEANT TANNER, older, crusty. He approaches, Brian notices the bump on his head. Brian smiles, innocent.
What's the problem?
Who thumped you?
Jack handle fell on me.

You have to come in. They hit this morning. Four black Civics. Shipping container from Japan. DVDs. Playstations. Notebook computevs. Insured for a million seven. The boss wants to see you. A bank of monitors shows Caltrans traffic camera views throughout L.A. Brian enters with the same confidence he brought to the sandwic shop. You nail these pieces of shit. We're counting on you.
They don't know what they're in for, sir. Waddaya think of this place?
I should'’a been a druglord. Brian grins and climbs the massive staircase. He stops at tall door with a hand lettered sign: STRACPRO SAIC BILKINS -- And under that: THE LION'S DEN

Set up in an ornately tasteless bedroom. On the wall a photo chart is labeled: ILLEGAL RACING TEAMS There's black teams, Asian teams, Chicano teams. Names an faces we will see again. Gentlemen, we're big time. I must have had fifty calls today. A lot of very important people have their eyes on us. Hate to ride your back, Officer O'Conner, but you're our best shot. Why focus there? Brian looks at Mia's picture and softens a notch. He has go back. Somehow.
If the Dominator's not popping these trucks, he knows who is. Brian gestures sweepingly at the mosaic of mugshots.
This world revolves around him. These peckernecks worship him, he's never lost a race. Race Wars is happening in a week. It's the "Burning Man" of illegal racing. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
He taps Mia Brian beams Blue Revision 05/05/2000 17. (2) ‘ 33

We know our suspects are deep in the scene as evidenced by their vehicles and skills, right? They will be at Race Wars. To beat Dominic Toretto, King of the quarter mile. I'll be there too, because after the racing's done and everyone's raving on ecstasy, our suspects will have a big criminal buddy hug and brag about how bad they are. When they will open their mouths, I will hear them.
Race Wars, huh? San Bernardino Sheriffs been trying to get in there three years running. How you gonna find the thing, Bri? They don't exactly put up posters. 's photo.
I'm going to work the sister. She'll know.
Harry Jackson cooperating?
Man has no choice. He's been an outstanding resource. He informed me Toretto's racing tonight at the L.A. Coliseum. I'll be there.
You're not racing. Whack some family in a minivan and the city's ass is . wide open for a huge payout. Hear me?

I was leery putting a greenhorn undercover, but you're soldiering well out there. I never had the priwilege to meet your father, but I'm sure he'd be quite proud of you.

Hold up, O'Conner. . Brian pauses.

You can't do your job with hands tied behind your back, Sometimes it's easier to ask for forgiveness than to ask for permission, Do what you have to tonight, but remember, that's an eighty thousand dollar car and we have to return it without a scratch.
(grins gratefully) I'll use my best judgement.
I know you will. Tanner looking at Brian, there is a strong connection between these two.
I worry about you. Toretto's a psycho, beating a guy half to death and all. I couldn't take it if you took a bullet in the back of the head. A beat, Brian darkens, intense.
That will never happen to me. Never. Tanner looking at Brian, with more to say. But he just claps Brian on the shoulder and nods for him to go.

vince's Civic driving alongside. Jesse and Vince staring.

Making the same moves. LEFT HANDS grab steering wheels. LEFT FEET step on clutches. RIGHT HANDS grab gearshifts. RIGHT FEET light on the gas. Four tachs blipping around 2000RPM.
Drop. Engines SCREAM. The four floor it. Clutches up. Tires spin and catch. Three cars surge forward.

Spins tires. Lost traction is lost time. He clutches correctly and takes off. 42 43 44 45 46 47 48  49 50 Si 52 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 25. INT. BRIAN'S SUPRA (MOVING) - NIGHT 4g RPMs climb. The turbo WHINES. The shiftlight. Off the throttle. RPMs drop. The bypass HISS. Clutch. 2nd gear. Throttle. RPMs climb. 50MPH. Stage one nitro-- --a solenoid CLICKS open. Nitrous floods the intake manifold -- BOOM! Adding another 100 horsepower. Brian is slammed into his seat. RPMs climbing... The shiftlight. Off the throttle -- clutch in -- 3rd gear ~- clutch out. A skylight has just been jimmied open. Brian's HEAD AND SHOULDERS appear in silhouette.
The drop is deadly. Dangling lube, oil and air hoses are the only way down.

Brian dangles from the skylight. He begins to swing. Back and forth. He kicks out his legs, snags the hose bundle with them. He slides down the hoses to the floor. Then Dominic joins Brian. And Vince. Now on terra firma, the three trade relieved looks. Brian steers his maglite across the darkness. Illuminatin the impressive equipment. This is the most elaborate gara we've seen yet. There's a dyno. Diagnostic gear. And a fancy pick-up for errands. Even Dominic is, impressed.
Damn, State of the art. Big bucks.
We gotta jack some of this shit. Two racers are on hydraulic lifts. Brian crosses to one, aims his maglite up into the engine compartment. No engin (CONTINUED)
They cross to the other lift. And stare up into another empty engine compartment. The three share a look.

Where the engines at? Brian wanders’ toward four small cars closely parked toge under the same tarp. They have Brian's full attention. Dominic's pocket CHIRPS, he pulls out his cell and checks the caller ID, angered by the distraction.
What, Jesse?
Jesse is slumped in his seat, terrified. Watching the Vie Long Beach Team return to the garage en masse. There's a dozen Hurricanes, several cars -- Pete's Mustang.
(into phone) They're coming.
Brian steps into the moonlight as he reaches to lift the tarp...

They're coming. Dominic shuts his cell, eyes wild. Brian freezes, looks u at the impossibly high skylight. The sound of MOTORCYCLES The three lock eyes. Dominic runs toward a car lift, he slides into the deep s underneath, his boots SPLASHING into ankle deep oil. Bria follows, stopping when he sees a tall stack of-- VCRs IN THEIR BOXES Hidden behind a row of tires. Dominic stands in the sump, under the car dh the lift, hi .38 ready.
Where the hell are you? Brian frantically copies VCR serial numbers onto his arm. The garage door begins rising. (CONTINUED)
100 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 52,
(hisses) Brian? Brian dives into the sump. SPLASH! -- As the lights come on. He pulls down his sleeve to hide the writing on his arm.

Pete and Lance enter with their entourage, some prime arm candy. Two of Pete's HENCHMEN drag a terrified man, TED HENDERSON, inside. They throw him to the floor. Pete grabs a waterhose and wraps it around Ted's neck, he turns beet red, GAGS. Pete grabs a lube hose. Pete tries to force the hose in his mouth.

Open your mouth. C'mon, Ted. Can't ever keep the big thing closed. Why now? Open it. Pete presses the nozzle under Ted's nostril. Fills his sinuses with 50 weight synthetic. Ted wretches and gags. Coughing in agony. Pete clamps Ted's head between his knees and fills his mo with oil. Ted struggles violently.

Watch from below the shelves he has wedged himself into. Safe for now, he enjoys the show with a mean little smile --just like Pete's team. Pete releases Ted, he vomits and writhes on the cement, blowing snot bubbles.
Peer over the edge of the sump, their eyes at floor level Both ankle deep in oil. Brian hates what he is witnessing

(softly hisses) We have to.stop this. - Dominic stills Brian with a hand on his back. Points ou the Mac in Lance's hand. Brian grits his teeth in frustration. Ted WHIMPERS. His wet eyes pleading. Pete lights a cigarette. (CONTINUED)
Where are they? Sell them to someone else. Couple Nissan Silvia S-15's engines would pull a premium a week before Race Wars. Who did you sell them to? Ted reaches in his pocket, hands Pete a card.
They're in my warehouse. Pete fingers the card, smiles. The danger has passed.
Kiss my shoes. Ted leans over to kiss Pete's feet. WHAM! Pete kicks him in the chest. Ted gasps like a fish, turns blue. Pete hands the card to Lance.
Go get them. Lance crosses to the pick-up, gets in with another TEAM MEMBER. The pick-up, six motorcycles are started. The doo is rolled open. The pick-up drives out with six motorcycl escorting it.
Taking advantage of the noise and distraction to low craw to the bathroom.
Do the same.
The alley behind it. Vince drops from a high window. Then Dominic and Brian, they look around, take off running. Toward Jesse's waiting VW at the end of the alley. . Cur TO:
Brian has the manifest from a truck hijacking. He finds t serial numbers for the VCR's. (CONTINUED)
He rolls up his sleeve. The serial numbers he copied are smeared illegibly. Brian SIGHS, angry at himself. He look at the manifest. Gets an idea.
Brian sits in the corner typing, he hasn't cleaned up fro the prior evening. Tanner enters. Shows Brian a mugshot o TED HENDERSON.
This him?
Yes, holy shit. That was quick.
Stand by. He's on probation for receiving stolen goods. Pentium motherboards from a burglary in Gardena. Your boy's a top echelon fence. They smell blood. Tanner slaps Brian's back
You tighten that noose quick. Bilkin's boss is flying out from DC. I wanna close this case before FBI God steps off his plane.
C'mon, it's pow-wow time. Brian grows nervous.
Bilkins leans back in his chair finishing Brian's report. Tanner and Brian await his verdict. Bilkins sets the repo down looks dryly at Brian. Then smiles. °
Let's move on this. Brian smiles, relieved. Tanner gives him a wink.
Because I'm dealing with a federal DA ' and judge. They're not rubber stamps like LA Superior. (MORE). (CONTINUED)
105 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 55. CONTINUED: ‘ 105
The first thing the DA will ask me is. how you developed this information.
A reliable confidential informant.
I need a name. It won't leave this room. Tanner nods for Brian to say it. Brian hesitates, a nervo ripple through his composure as he makes a decision.

Dominic Toretto. He witnessed the assault on Henderson. He provided the numbers off the VCRs. He saw the four black Civics parked inside the premises. Pete Tran's our guy, I guarantee it. Let's get the affidavit into the judge, get signed off and hit this piece of shit with a tactical platoon now. We got mass reasons to take homeboy down.
Going native on us, Bri? Brian grins, his enthusiasm is contagious.

Worry not, Bri. We'll go in forty eight hours after we work up a raid plan. We will romp and stomp. Meanwhile, get in the field and keep your ear to the ground. Brian smiles, stands, pauses as he grabs the doorknob.
Sir, in light of Toretto's cooperation, it would be unfair of us to pursue any unrelated criminal matters against him. A beat.
You're right. We'll leave him alone. That made Brian's day, he fights not to show it as he exi Once safely outside the office, he grins big. cuT TO:  106 107 108 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 56.
A hot day. Brian, Dominic, Jesse, Leon and even Vince str Brian's 240SX, tearing out everything. Seats, windows, trim, carpet. Everything goes.

The Nissan has been stripped to the unibody frame. Chains and blocks attached to it. Brian, Dominic, Vince and Leon use winches and sledgehammers to straighten it. Their shirts are off, the sweat pours. Jesse uses his watchful eyes and lasers and reflectors to guide them.
Mia takes frozen meat from the big freezer outside. She can't take her eyes off Brian.
Okay! There! Perfect! They stop laboring. Brian notices Mia, they trade lingeri smiles. Dominic notices and crosses to Brian. He nods for Brian to go ahead.
You break her heart, I'll break your balls.
Mia works on a pot of meatball sauce. Brian enters. She's ready with a glass of icewater.
Thanks. How's my painting coming?
I haven't started yet. I want to know more about you first. Brian traces his finger along the rim of his glass.
Wouldn't this be nice with a little salt around the rim, a little premium tequila, crushed ice, lime juice..?
Yes. I'11 pick you up at ten. (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 57. 108 CONTINUED: ‘ 108 ot It's a date. They smile.
Cozy and relaxed. Candles on the tables, MARIACHIS in B.G Mia is absolutely radiant in a sexy little dress. She lic salt from her margarita.
How's my painting coming?

I haven't started yet. The picture I took, it's your expression. When I paint someone's face, I'm really painting their feelings. You looked so content sitting there, I thought I'd get a good picture. But there was s0 much anger in your eyes. What are you so angry about?
C'mon. It's just a bad picture. And that's that. A beat of uncomfortable silence, then:
Miss Arizona?
No. I was Mr. Arizona. Mia has a little laugh. The tension broken.
Okay, you got me. Have a lot of family back there, mister? Brian darkens a little bit.
No. I don't. I have an Uncle Who watches out for me. My daddy, he passed on.
I know. Dominic told me. What happened? A beat, Brian looks into her gentle brown eyes. (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 58.

Some evil scumbag snuck up from behind and shot him in the head. For a damn wallet. He'd a stepped up to my pops like a man, outcome would of been different. He was such a good guy. (serious) I'll get the punk who did it. I'll get him.
How's your mom taking it?
Bad. They were super close. Still in love after like thirty years. I guess she couldn't live without him. She got sick. . Next thing I know I'm at her funeral.
That's so sad. I'm sorry, I shouldn't be taking you there.
It's part of who I am.
(softly) Is that why you're so angry? Brian looking at her a beat. Surprised by the obvious. He nods his head: yes. Mia squeezes his hand reassuringly.

Amazing how the folks leave their mark, huh? My dad wasn't there when he was there. Dominic worships him. I know he showed you the shrine. The only thing that made dad happy was building and racing cars. He chased my mom off. She hid in New York or New Jersey, not sure which. I kind'a wish she'd taken us with. Dad could be scary, I get it. Future looked bright for a while. We took in some strays and made our own family Dominic got his operators license and drove big rigs and I was in art college. Speeding tickets and student loans killed those. dreams. It's Brian's turn to give a reassuring hand squeeze.
Brian and Mia cross the parking lot.
Why doesn't Dominic race professionally?
He got in a fight and they banned him from the tracks. They arrive at her bitchin Honda Accord. Mia unlocks it, pops the hood,
Three point two V-six with hot cams, sleeved and ported. Tanabe exhaust, G- force chip. Airflow intake. Ball bearing turbo.
Dominic hooked you up.
I hooked me up, Brian. I got grease in my blood, remember? Wanna talk car? I can get that from anybody. I want more. Get in, I'm driving. They get in her hot Accord.

Rocketing westward on Mulholland Drive. A carpet of shimmering lights below. Brian whiteknuckles the door handle. Mia whips through the turns with hair raising precision, a naughty smirk on her face. Mia passes a huge Mercedes. Into oncoming HEADLIGHTS! She cuts back in her lane with an inch to spare. She LAUGHS, Brian looks at her thinks she's insane and loves
Near an LAX main runway and an abandoned housing development. Some CHOLOS from Venice party around a bonfire.
(CONTINUED)
113 114 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 60. CONTINUED: ‘ 113 Mia's Accord. Brian and Mia sit on the hood and share a pack of Twinkies, watching the moon set over the ocean.
This is my beach. That's my ocean. My moon.

This is nice, thanks for bringing me. Brian is relaxed, at ease like we haven't seen before. Mi looks Brian, at his moonlit features against the starry s Like one of her paintings. Ever so cautiously, she takes his face in her hands and stares deeply into his eyes.

This is how I want to paint you. They kiss, gentle and tentative at first. Then passion an hunger take over. They kiss deeply, Brian slides his hand up her thighs and pulls her closer. She chews on his ear, her breath hot. He hooks a finger in the waistband of her panties and tugs.
No. Not here...
...where..? Mia looks around with a naughty smile.
...here... She pulis him down to the sand. A 747 takes off. It's engines SCREAMING at full thrust.
An industrial area. The turbodiesel of a Big Rig GROWLS a it rolls down an empty boulevard toward a ffeeway onramp. drives under a...
Where the BANDIT waits. He jumps-~~ (CONTINUED)
114 115 116 117 118 119 120 121 122 123 124 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 61. CONTINUED: ‘ --THUDS onto the roof of the trailer. The Big Rig RUMBLES up the onramp. With four BLACK CIVICS following it.
Bare except for a lawnchair and the futon Brian sleeps on He answers his RINGING cell, half asleep.
Huh?
They hit last night in Santa Fe Springs. Bilkins pushed the raid up to this afternoon at seventeen hundred. Go back to sleep, kid. CLICK. Brian sits up and rubs his eyes, wide awake.
Brian's 240SX is painted primer gray. Now the work can begin in earnest.
Three dozen SWAT OFFICERS (FBI and Long Beach PD) sit at classroom desks as Bilkins, Tanner and Muse explain their targets.

text: Mia cleans her spray equipment. Brian checks his watch.
Harry needs me to make a parts run up to Simi Valley. He kisses and to her dismay crosses to Harry's pick-up an takes off. . CUT To:
Harry's pick-up parks next to an unmarked car. cUuT TO: 125 126 127 128 129 130 131 132 133 134 135 136 137 138 139 140 141  142 143 144 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 63.
Muse drives. Bilkins up front. Tanner in back with Brian, showing him the fifty page raid plan. .
We're hitting three locations. There's seven gang members in the garage, Team 1's got that. Lance Nguyen's house is Team 2's, Pete Tran was observed at his residence. He's Team 3's property.
Who's Team 3? Tanner hands Brian a black hood and a flak jacket.
We are. Brian grins and pulls on the scary black hood.
Much better.
Eight SWAT COPS in black battle gear SLAP home magazines. KERCHACK! Let the bolts of their weapons slide home. The van stops. The back doors fly open...
Flying out of the back of the truck. Running towards Pete Tran's garage. A SECOND VAN spills out eight more SWATs. EXT. PETE TRAN'S GARAGE — DAY 144
Four MECHANICS, older Vietnamese, throw their hands up as wave of sixteen cop-commandos rolls toward them. They are violently tackled.

Running through the garage. Seven of PETE'S TEAM watching video on two couches in the corner. They are ferociously taken down by a well armed offensive line. curt TO:  145 146 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 64.

Lance finishes brushing his teeth, just out of the shower towel around his waist. He douses himself with talcum powder. Goofs off in the mirror a silly beat. SMASH! The window breaks. Lance stares incredulously at a SWAT COP aiming his MP-5 at him, its laser dotting his forehead. WHAM! The door is kicked in, Lance is tackled by two SWAT COPS. A third SWAT COP in B.G. talks into his radio.
Base, team two. Bingo.
Copy. Gonna buy the Dominator a steak. Lance was listening. cuT TO:

Solidly middle class, nicely decorated. Pete sits at the dinner table with his MOTHER, FATHER, his teenage SISTER. Two older AUNTS and their HUSBANDS. WHAM! The front door is kicked open. The BOOM of a flashbang. Brian runs in with a shotgun, scary as hell with the blac mask. He kicks Pete out of his chair. Drops a knee on his neck and shoves the shotgun under his chin. Muse, Tanner and Bilkins follow, aiming weapons at Pete's terrified family. His Mother and Aunts SCREAM.
Take anything you want. Please don't hurt us.

(hisses) ° We're cops, asshole. Pete stares daggers at the blue eyes behind the hood. Bri grinds his face in the carpet and handcuffs him. They hau Pete to his feet. His FATHER crosses to him, gives hima shamed, hurt look, it becomes an angry glare and he SLAPS Pete, who looks away.  a Blue Revision 05/05/2000 65.
147 148 149 Harry signs legal papers on L.A. County D.A. letterhead. is extremely grateful.

Thank you, man. Fines I can handle. I'll pay all that. Probation, no problem. I'm not even jaywalking. But prison, that's... Prison is very scary for Harry. Brian gathers the papers, seals them in an envelope.
You're cool now.
Thanks, Brian. They tap fists. Dominic enters, sees Harry's emotion.
Jeez, Harry, he'll be back. Hurry up, Brian. Toretto pops back out. Brian drops the envelope in the outgoing mail box. Gives Harry a smile and exits. cur TO:
Well north of L.A. The ocean dashes itself against the rocks. The 240SX cruises North, PURRING low and throaty. It slows and stops for a red light.

Brian behind the wheel. Dominic in the passenger seat. They enjoy the beautiful California day. Brian is ecstati about his reborn Nissan. Dominic in the passenger seat, a laptop open on his knees. Making adjustments to a fuel mapping program. “
Okay... Standby... Go! Brian stomps the gas. Clutch up. The car takes off.
Shift! Double clutch! Shift! Shift! (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 66. CONTINUED: ‘ . 149 Brian works through the gears. The car passing 120MPH.
Floor it! Wind her out! The engine nearing redline, SCREAMING in protest.
Brake! Brake! Stomp the damn brakes! Brian does. The car swerving wildly as it bleeds off spee The anti-lock brakes JACKHAMMERING. Brian barely keeps it on the road. Dominic looking at Brian.
Drive hard. Smash the throttle like a bug. Kick the clutch in. Shift hard. Use force. Pimp slaps.
Pimp slaps? Dominic SLAPS Brian's head.

Like that. Brian gives him a look. Dominic smiles. Then Brian smiles They stop at a red light. Brian's BEEPER goes off, he ignores it. EXT. PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - DAY 149Aa B red Lamborghini Diablo GT pulls alongside them. It's vanity plate reads: @ THE BIZ Dominic looks at the TALENT AGENT behind the wheel, the gorgeous ELITE MODEL riding shotgun.
Nice car. What it cost? The Agent eyes Dominic like a bug. Dominic just grins bac
Four hundred twenty three thousand dollars. The Agent REVS the engine, he wants to impress his-girl. The light about to change. Brian and Dominic trade looks. The light. turns GREEN.
Hit it. (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 67.

Brian mashes the gas. Beats the Lamborghini off the line. Brian works the gears. The speedometer climbing fast. Brian's Nissan blows away the Lamborghini. It shrinks in the rearview as the frustrated Agent gives up.
Man, this car is fast. Easily the victor, Brian eases off the throttle. He and Dominic tap fists.

Homeboy got jipped EXT. NEPTUNE'S NET - DAY 149¢ Brian pulls up to the funky restaurant. There are SURFER DUDES and CHICKS. BIKERS and their BABES. Dominic and Brian exit the car. Brian's BEEPER goes off again. Domini thrusts his cellphone at Brian.
Get your page. Brian's heart pounds as he takes the phone and dials--
Tanner waits by the phone. It RINGS--
--Hello?
Yo, it's Brian.
Yo, Brian. Get your ass back to base xight freaking now. Tanner hangs up.
Brian expertly plays it off.
All right, have a good one. Later. Brian hangs up. Hands the phone back. (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 68. 151A CONTINUED: ‘ 151A 152 153
My Uncle. Checking up on my ass Dominic looks at the cell's screen.
L.A. number.
He drives out sometimes. Dominic hits SEND. Brian's mouth dry as a bone.
The phone RINGS.
Hello?
Who's this?
Who's this?
I'm me, That's who it is. What are you to Brian? Tanner REACTS, realizes who he is talking to.
I'm family. Tell him the least he can do is have dinner with me. I'm not out here every day.
Yeah, I'll tell hin.
Staying with Dominic -- He SNAPS shut his cell.

Least you can do is have dinner with your Uncle. Dominic's paranoia abates. Brian is relieved. Dominic pulls a toy race car from his pocket. Hands it to Brian. Brian notes driving instructions written on it. 1 (CONTINUED)
154 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 69. CONTINUED: ‘ 153
What's this?
Your invitation to Race Wars. Brian grins and they enter the restaurant.
Establishing.
A very angry Bilkins sits at his desk glaring at Brian ov steepled fingers.

The vehicles in Tran's garage were not black Civics. The machine gun didn't turned up. The VCRs were legally purchased from the Good Guys by Tran's Uncle who owns a video store and dubs pornos. We have nothing tying Tran's team to the hijackings. They O.R.'d on bail an hour ago. Ail of them. Prosecutor's waiting until Monday to drop the charges in case the machine .gun turns up. Officer O'Conner, you have embarrassed me in spectacular fashion. JI have zero tolerance for misconduct. I'm placing you on home duty pending the Internal Affairs investigation. I recommend you contact an attorney. You are dismissed.
Yessir. Stunned, Brian retreats to the door.
A spectacular view. Tanner leans on the rail, haggard, solemn. Brian joins him. Tanner fixes him with a look.
Either Toretto fed you a line of shit or you're the one who fed us a shit sandwich. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 70. ‘ 154
I know you're too smart to let that goombah play you so I'm leaning toward the latter. He never gave you those serial numbers, did he? Brian can trust Tanner, he always has.
I copied them from the manifests. Tanner shakes his head sadly.

Sergeant Tanner, Pete Tran is our guy. I know I'm right. I learned from the best cop who ever wore a badge: my dad. He taught me it's black and white. We gotta do our job and stomp these insects, like the dick-lice son- of-an-asshole who shot my daddy in the head.

It doesn't matter who you lock up, you can't bring him back. You've always been a good kid but it scares the shit out of me to hear you talk like that. Black and white? There's something I have to tell you. (deep breath) Brian, the man you think your dad was and who he really was are two different things. Your dad was a top drawer police officer. But he was just as human as the rest of us, (a beat, quietly) He was having an affair with Jack Van Patton's wife. Brian REACTS, ready to throw Tanner off the balcony.
Being a good detective and all, Van Patton found out. He ambushed your father, not some criminal at large. A brother cop killed your dad. - Tanner squeezes Brian's shoulder. Let's him absorb that.”
That's why Van Patton stuck a shotgun in his mouth. It was a mess. But everyone did what they had to do to make it right. Nothing's black and white but the damn cars we drive. (CONTINUED)
161 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 71.
Brian looks like he can't breathe. He grabs the rail for support. Blinks back tears.
Jesus Christ, Lou. What am I supposed to do now?

Save your ass by cracking this damn case. Otherwise come Monday, they'11 rip you to pieces. Your first instinct was this Race.Wars thing. Follow your nose. Brian looks at Tanner. Grateful for the reprieve.
I'll do what I gotta do.
Brian's Nissan rockets across the bleak landscape.
Brian holds the toy car Dominic gave him. Ahead a lonely intersection quarters the desert.
A leathery OLD MAN, the only sign of life for miles sits a rock. He watches Brian's car pull up. Brian shows him the toy car. The Old Man points out the road leading to t mountains.
EXT. DESERT - DAY ” 161 Through a LONG LENS and dancing heat ripples we SEE a gathering. Vague, indefinite, then color and form impose themselves as we move...
The Woodstock of underground racing. Held at an abandoned airport. Hundreds of amazing cars, hundreds of people. Ra THUMPS from dozens of speakers.
Run drag races. Long lines of paired cars await their tur ENGINE NOISE rises and falls with each quick race. MUSIC BOOMS from a hundred stereos.
Approaching a parking area-near a TENT CITY. Brian navigates through an eclectic crowd, everyone from gangbangers to Suburbanites. He's wary, watchful, looking for answers on the faces he sees.
Bleachers have been set up along two runways. Old tires a hay bales for safety. DISPLAYS show their times.
Cars awaiting their turn two by two. INSPECTORS in white lab coats check them out, soap numbers on windshields.
Brian, walking through the cars. He SEES Jesse's VW waiti in line to race. He crosses to Jesse and leans in his window. They tap fists.
Yo, Jesse. Where's everyone at? Jesse points. Now Brian SEES Dominic, his team, Mia, standing by their cars, which are parked in a staging are near the runway.
Wish me luck. Brian sees worry on Jesse's face.
What's up? (CONTINUED)
164 165 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 73. CONTINUED: ‘ 164
I'm racing for cars.
Ain't this your dad's car? You can't bet what's not yours.
’ No, lookit, I'll win this fool's car, then me and my pops can roll together when he gets out of prison.

Not if they lock him back up after he kills you. Call it off, who you racing? Brian looks over Jesse's car at the racer he's paired wit Brian REACTS -- The other racer is Pete Tran, driving his Mustang. He glares at Brian, who glares right back.
You better win, man. An OFFICIAL with a.clipboard waves Jesse and Pete forward It's their turn to race. Brian watches Jesse pull up to t starting line. Jesse's having second thoughts.

Time displays are reset to zero. A stoplight between the lanes glows red. The light turns yellow. The two drivers tense with anticipation. Jesse grabs the shifter. Pushes in the clutch, trades looks with Pete. The light turns green... VROOM! Tires spin as the VW and Mustang launch like missiles. Jesse's head is thrown back, he pulls ahead for an early lead. Then Pete closes the gap until they are dead even. They burn through the gears. Jesse gives Pete the finger and hits the nitrous. He shoo ahead several lengths. Pete isn't worried.
Too soon, my child. Pete eyes his gage cluster, the track ahead, calculating. Then hits the nitrous... (CONT INUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 74. CONTINUED: ‘ 165
Busts the finish first. Then Jesse by half a car length, with tears in his eyes.
Dominic shakes his head sadly at Jesse's loss. Then Mia a his team REACT.
Jesse keeps going--
Where's Jesse going? --right out the gate. Gaining speed, SMASHES through the outer fence and is gone.
Dominic's team trades surprised looks. Brian runs over an joins them, Mia happy to see him. Brian taps fists with Dominic.
Jesse raced Sneaky Pete for pinks.
Dammit. It's a problem he didn't need. He watches Pete pulls up a get out of his Mustang. And-is quickly joined on foot by Lance and a dozen surly Long Beach Viets.
I won. That's my car now, where's he taking it?

To the car wash or something. You'll get the car. We're not shysters. Just be cool. Pete looks at Dominic, scowls. His team menaces closer. Vince looks ready to chew Lance's head off. Leon, Letty even Mia, are ready to scrap. A crowd gathering.
Be cool? Cops were up in my house shaming me in front of my family because you dropped a dime on me. Cops were talking about you on the radio. (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 . 75. 16SA CONTINUED: ‘ 165A Dominic REACTS. And despite himself, Brian too.

Bullshit. I never dropped a dime on no one. I'm not down with the Man. Pete points at Brian accusingly. PETE . Bullshit. Your blue eyed butt boy is the Man. The team out there jacking trucks, I bet it's your team. Don't even think you're putting your sins on me. I'm sick of you messing with my team. It's stopping. Now. --CRACK! Dominic nails Pete on the tip of his jaw. Pete throws a combo, landing one on Dominic's forehead. Now Dominic really goes nuts, savaging Pete with a vicious series of blows. Vince and Lance punch each other. Pete's Crew surges forward-- -~Brian swings at two Vietnamese who rush him. Letty stan her ground, throwing solid punches. As does Leon. Mia clotheslines a Vietnamese guy running at Dominic with a screwdriver. He goes down on his back, the screwdriver is suddenly seized from his hand as several sequoia-sized SAMOAN SECURITY GUARDS wade into the fracas, separating t - combatants.
Get back! Y'all ain't squabblin' here. The teams trade hard stares as they part. Pete, his eyebr split and bleeding, wipes blood from his face and flicks at Dominic.
This isn't over. Dominic tries to charge Pete, but is restrajned.

Sorry, Toretto, keeping the peace is all. Harmony, bro. Dominic understands, they tap fists. Dominic and his team head back to their tents. Letty sucks on a split knuckle. Dominic looks at Brian, angry and suspicious. Vince looking at Brian, walking with Mia. (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 76. CONTINUED: (2) ‘ 165A
He's a nutcase. There's no way you're a cop. Brian grabs her waist reassuringly. Dominic waves Vince over and whispers to him as they walk.

It's time to dance. A full on rave is in effect. A thousand plus bodies undulate to a techno throb. Strobes flicker. Lights pulse. Dancers wave lightsticks and glow in the dark staffs and hoops. A Dd works the 1's and 2's from atop a tall tower of scaffolding aglow with a thousand lightsticks.
Brian exits a port-a-potti, hitching up his pants.

Brian is surprised to arrive to find no one about. He begins searching the bags and equipment. His experienced hands work quickly. Then he finds it -- A speargun tip. Brian stares at the damning evidence in his hand. He sags visibly as he realizes Dominic's team are the hijackers. CUT To:
Brian moves through the cars, then stops in his tracks.

Mia and Dominic have a heated argument. Letty and Leon si in Letty's Eclipse. Vince waits in Dominic's RX7. Mia clearly doesn't want Dominic to leave. She grabs his arm He jerks away, gets in his car.

Brian watches them go, the wheels of revelation turn. Bri feels chopped off at the knees. Dominic is the crook he i after. Brian takes a beat to compose himself, runs back t the tent city.  169 174 175 176 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 77.
EXT. TORETTO CAMP - NIGHT — 175, Brian waiting for Mia, all smiles, like nothing is wrong. She arrives.
Where's everyone at?
They're meeting us by the DJ's tower. C'mon. Mia runs off toward the rave. Brian follows with urgency, hurt by her lie.
Mia, wait!

Mia plunges into the crowd, Brian follows her deeper and deeper into the writhing mass of limbs. She teases him, playing hide and seek in the humanity. Trance dancers in various altered states jostle Brian. He plows his way through entranced bodies.
Brian loses sight of Mia. Searching through the crowd. More and more frantic.

Brian has lost her. He stands there, looking around, the only static figure in a sea of colorful motion. A tap on his shoulder. He turns. It's Mia. Dancing, sexy, smiling. Brian grabs her shoulders and stills her.
Every badge in the Southland warits to blow your brother out of his boots. This is your chance to save his life.
What are you talking about? (CONTINUED)
Blue Revision 05/05/2000 78.
I'm a cop. I'm investigating the hijackings. I'm from Simi Valley, not Arizona, Mia REACTS. Fights away from his grip. She punches him hard in the.stomach.
You asshole. You lied to me, Brian. Oh, God. Is that even your name? What's your real name?
Brian O'Conner. They suggested I use my real first name to be more natural. Mia can't believe this.
That's so wrong. You played me like a piano. You don't do that to people.
My feelings are real, Mia.
; Mine were too, They were. But you lied to me. Brian and Mia look at each other as their hearts break.
Okay, I lied. But unless you help Dominic, you're gonna be standing by a hole in the ground with him in it. Help me save him. A beat. Mia grabs his hand.
Let's go. cut To: 177 EXT. ABANDONED GAS STATION - NIGHT ° 177 A lonely, tired old building in the desert.
Four cars parked under tarps. Three tarps are pulled off reveal the stealth black Civics.
(CONTINUED)
178 179 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 79. CONTINUED: ‘ 177A To reveal Leon, Letty, Dominic and Vince.
Don't like doing this without Jesse. Vince screws a tip onto a speargun.
This is sketchy with all the heat.
It's perfect. Two thousand people saw us tonight. .
A FIGURE on a motorcycle watches the abandoned gas statio with binoculars. cur TO:
The three cars gaining speed. PUSH IN ON:
Right through its darkened windshield--
--Dominic drives, Next to him is Vince, both wear earpieces. The mood serious, professional.
We're a car short so Letty, you got right side. Leon, keep on the scanners, Man wants us bad. We cool?
Her gameface on. Tightening her four point harness.
I'm cool.
He adjust the police scanners in the dash.
I'm cool.
(CONTINUED)
You cool, Vee? A beat.
I'm cool. cuT TO:
Brian doing 120MPH. Mia has a map on her knees.
Civics are stashed here outside Thermal. Brian looks over at the map.
They wouldn't double back. And the ten is too well patrolled. Shit, that leaves...
All this. Mia's finger points to an area where four highways come together. Brian grabs his cell and dials.
Tanner fast asleep with his WIFE. The phone RINGS. He answers groggily.
Tanner.
It's me. I got a tasker. Call Pac Bell security and get a cell trace going on Toretto's phone.
I'm on it. Making headway?
Bigtime.
(CONTINUED)
CLICK. Brian hangs up. He and Mia trade a look.
A tandem Big Rig, king of the road, plies the night.
The DRIVER is a lean mean former Marine, a plug of tobacc in his cheek, Neil Young on the radio.

Blind him. He grabs a chopped shotgun off the seat next t him. KERCHACK! Loads a live one. This big boy's playing for keeps. A pick-up passes him. Keeps going. The Driver relaxes a notch, puts down the weapon.
Brian's cell rings.
Hello?
Northbound 86. Mile one fourteen outside Coachella. Watch your six, Lone Ranger.
Everyday. Brian hangs up. Mia looking at the map. Points straight ahead.
We're good. Exit's four miles that way.
Three black Civics zoom closer to their target, lights of
Is the Tandem Rig.  186 187 189 190 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 82, INT.» DOMINIC'S CIVIC (MOVING) - NIGHT 186 Vince puts on a gas mask. Dominic pulls closer to the Tandem Rig.
Big honker.
Two Civics take position on either side of the Tandem Rig They hit their HEADLIGHTS.
The Driver REACTS. SEES the Civics on either side. Dominic's Civic pulls in front. Vince stands up through t sunroof in a gasmask, aiming the speargun.
The anchor pierces the windshield. The Civic guns it and the windshield is torn from its frame. The Driver lays a hand on the shotgun and grins. Ready.
Vince reloads the speargun. Aims. Fires...

The spear embeds itself into the seat by the Driver. Vince stands atop Dominic's Civic. An insane surfer. He activates the winch on his chest and leaps-~ ~-The winch pulls him to the Tandem Rig. WHAM! Vince hits the grill. He grabs the bulldog hood ornament, pulls a chemical grenade from his pocket and pu the pin and tries to pull himself onto the hood. Dominic pulls far ahead to recon the freeway.

The Driver SEES Vince's head pop up. He aims through the open windshield-~ BOOM! He fires -- Shredding the hood by Vince's head. Vince drops the smoking grenade. It skitters across the highway, HISSING smoke. (CONTINUED)
KERCHACK! The Driver shucks in a fresh shell and aims at Vince's hand gripping the Mack bulldog. BOOM! Nine SCREAMING buckshot pellets-- --Gouge the hood, and Vince's hand, shredding his glove.
Vince lets go. BANGS against the grill, hanging by the steel cable attached to his chest.
I'm hit. Guy's got a boomer. Shoot this fucker,
(filtered) No way. That thing jackknifes, you're all dead.
Get me off'a here, now! Dominic's Civic instantly drops back, ready to help...
Three HURRICANE MOTORCYCLES appear like demons.
On the lead bike. He pulls the Mac~11 from his jacket. Behind him is--
Who opens the throttle wide on his bike and pulls ahead o Pete. An overpass, its CONCRETE COLUMNS just ahead.
Boss, we got bad company. Pete zips alongside Dominic, who's Civic is.ebumper to bu with the Tandem Rig.
Fearing Pete's Mac, the Driver lays down on the seat.
Aims the Mac at Dominic. (CONTINUED)

You're going down for this shit, not me. BRRDDDDDDT! He shoots Dominic's front tire. Rubber shreds off. The magnesium rims GRIND on the asphalt, trailing sparks. The Rig is swinging back and forth. The two trailers oscillate back and forth in ever increasing arcs.
She sees Lance getting in position to shoot out her tire.
Oh, no you ain't... Letty stomps the BRAKE, whips the wheel. Her car spins.
Suddenly staring at the side of Letty's Civic. Too late to correct. WHAM! He hits and ricochets into--
SPLAT! His bike EXPLODES. And that's the end of Lance.
Spinning, WHACKS a concrete column. Shearing off the back The wreckage comes to rest and an unscathed Letty thanks rollcage.
You okay Smurfette?
Yeah, I'm fine.
Get her.

head_text.subj: LEON'S CAR SLOWS. DOES A 180. AND HEADS BACK TO LETTY. 19

text: Looks back at the roiling fireball consuming his friend.
Lance, no! He pulls a fresh mag from his jacket. Now he's going to kill Dominic.  198 199 200 201 202 203 - Blue Revision 05/05/2000 85.
Unstraps the cable reel from his chest, wraps a turn of cable around his forearm and leans out forward fromthe grill. So he can leap onto the roof of:
Swinging back and forth in time with the swerving Rig. No easy with a drive wheel running on the rim.
Appears alongside Dominic. Dominic knows it's for keeps this time. He jerks the whee ducks, swerving away. Just as-~ Vince jumps. And Pete opens fire.
Rounds pepper Dominic's car, the hood, the delicate engin Vince falls under the rig's massive bumper. Being dragged by the cable on his arms.
And the remaining Hurricanes are far, far up the road mak a speedy getaway.
Is a tough costumer, he pulls himself out from under the truck. Now halfway up the grill.
I'm okay. I'm okay. He's happily back on the grill.
Is dying. The engine HOWLS as it chews itself to scrap. THOOMP! A small explosion under the hood. And the engine quits.

That's all she's got. I need a ride. Leon, with Letty already on board, SEES Dominic's disable Civic up a ahead rolling to a stop up a ahead. SCREECH! H slams on the brakes to pick up Dominic.  204 205 206 207 208 209 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 86.
The anchor pulls free from the seat, flies out the window
Falls under the cab.
Catches on the Bulldog hood ornament.
Vince is buffeted violently against the tires. The cable tears into his flesh of his arm.
Brian and Mia drive past Lance's burning Hurricane and Letty's demolished Civic.
It went bad.
Real bad. Next they pass Dominic's smoking and shot-up Civic.
Two down.
Ahead is Leon's Civic, and it's catching up to the Tandem Rig -- That is dragging Vince underneath.
It's vince!

head_text.subj: BRIAN FLOORS IT, PASSING THE CIVIC. 209

text: Brian guides his car alongside the trailer where Vince is dragging.
Drive! Mia climbs onto Brian's lap. Their limbs tangling and untangling as Brian gives her the controls.
I got it! (CONTINUED)
Brian opens the sunroof. Stands up, buffeted by wind.

Closer! Closer! Mia guides the car right alongside the trailer. She works the wheel, expertly following the back and forth swing. Brian leans way out of the sunroof. Hanging over the side of the car, his legs bracing him. He REACTS to the paveme zooming past his face. He extends his arms, reaching for Vince.
Tears out. Cable WHIPPING--
About to slide under large dual wheels-- Brian grabs Vince's belt with both hands. He pulls him in a bearhug.

Got him! Stop! Stop! Mia whips the car away from the Tandem Rig. EEEEEEEEEE! Stomps the brakes, the car swerving violently, Brian's ar tight around Vince's torso. The Tandem Rig goes on its way. The 240SX stops on the shoulder.

Brian gently lays Vince on the street. Kneels over him. Vince is pretty torn up. The cable has mutilated his righ forearm. He has bad road rashes. The black Civic comes to stop near them and Dominic is out like a shot. Brian does first aid assessment, all business.
You know what you're doing? °
Gimme your belt. Dominic yanks off his belt. Hands it to Brian. Who tourniquets Vince's arm just below the armpit. Brian straddles Vince and does heart thrusts. (CONTINUED)
212 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 88. CONTINUED: ‘ 212 Dominic gets ready to blow air in Vince's lungs. Brian ca see he has had training.

Vee, I'm kicking your ass if you die. They. administer CPR for a long beat. Mia gets out of the car and watches Brian, struck by how earnest he is. | After a set of chest thrusts, Brian checks for a pulse. T his great relief, he finds one.
He's back.
He's breathing, Dominic's relief is clear. He looks at Brian.
Someone doesn't start a couple full bore IVs, he's dead in ten minutes. Brian flips open his cell.
Highway Patrol. State your emergency.

(into phone) This is Officer Brian O'Conner. I'm off duty LAPD. I need a lifeflight rollout. My twenty's the 86 Highway at mile marker fifty six. One trauma victim. Twenty two years old. Six foot. One eighty. He's in shock, bleeding out and in cardiac arrest.
Okay buddy, I'm putting them in the air, Gimme your badge real quick.

One nine six zero four. « Dominic looking at Brian, overwhelmed with betrayal. Bria feels just as betrayed, his jaw muscles rippling as he clenches his teeth. Then Vince begins shaking violently. Brian and Dominic give him their full attention.
A STAR on the horizon is moving.
Spotlights zoom across the desert. Then onto the freeway. Then onto the black Civic, Brian's 240SX and a cluster of people below.
Brian covers Vince with his body as debris swirl in the powerful chopper's rotorwash. it is a maelstrom of light and noise.

The helicopter hovers over the freeway and lands. Instant two PARAMEDICS pop out and run TOWARDS CAMERA with aid pa and a trauma board. The Paramedics strap Vince to the board. Brian helps carr him to the waiting chopper.
Move! Move!
Vince is loaded into the back of the air ambulance. Brian and Mia pile in.
Get in! Get in! Brian looks over his shoulder.
The black Civic with Dominic, Leon and Letty inside is hightailing it out of there.

Brian isn't surprised, he expected as much.e CREW CHIEF slams the door, gives a thumbs up and the pilo twists the throttle. The desert drops away. Mia looks at Brian, who is watching the Paramedics start on Vince and prep bags of blood expander. Brian feels Mia gaze and turns te look at her. Mia squeezes his hand. cuT TO:  216 217 218 219 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 90.
Brian and Mia somber. Doing a hundred on the 10 East. Heading back into L.A. The spires of downtown are amber towers of flame as the sun gives them its morning kiss.
The big bad black Buick Regal is parked on the lawn. The front door is open, Brian's 240SX pulls to a stop and Bri and Mia get out. They look at the Buick.
What are you going to do to him? Brian gives her a look
Dominic exiting the front door with a shotgun.
Instinctively draws his gun. Draws a bead on Dominic.
Drop it Toretto! No more running! Dominic stops. Lowers the shotgun to his side.
I didn't run from you. I had to find Jesse. Pete Tran's got him. I knew this shit would happen. You gonna shoot me, cop? Dominic is desperate, anxious. Brian lowers his pistol.
Lance Nguyen's dead. Vince lost his arm. Least he's stable. Enough is enough. Tell me where Jesse is. I'll get a SWAT unit in there. We'll handle it.
Want his blood on your hands? You know Pete's a twisted freak. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
He hears a siren or sees any more SWAT ninjas, he's blowing Jesse's head off. He's a kid, man. He's like family.
What are you gonna do? Lose your head too? You know what kind of firepower they got. A beat as Dominic looks at Brian in anguish.
I gotta do something, Brian. I'm all he's got. Brian bites his lip, thinks a beat. Then:
No you're not. Let's go. Dominic is relieved. He gets in the Buick and its massive engine ROARS to life. Brian, gets back in his car, gives Mia a worried look. Both cars depart with haste.
In San Pedro near the Los Angeles Harbor facilities. Dominic's Buick pulls behind a warehouse. Brian's 240SX stops alongside it.
Don't let him get himself killed. Brian looks at Mia.
I won't. Brian and Dominic exit their cars at the same time, weapo ready. They trade a look -- They're in this together. Mia getting out of Brian's car.
Stay in the car. She does, very reluctantly. Dominic points the way. He and Brian cross to some dumpsters. Checking weapons. Dominic fumbles with the shotgun's action. (CONTINUED)
222 223 224 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 92. CONTINUED: ‘ 221

Gimme the shotgun. (off Dominic's look) I shoot like you drive. Dominic gives him the shotgun. Brian hands him his Glock. They crouch behind the dumpsters, eyeing a warehouse. It looks like no one is here this quiet Sunday morning.
The guy who moves my shit, that's where he keeps everything.
Ted Henderson. Dominic shoots Brian a look.
Guess you only look dumb. Brian is observing the area with his trained eyes.
A big sliding door is open about 2 feet. Brian and Domini approach the open door. It feels like a trap.
Let's run for it. They back up for a good running start. And run as fast as they can for the intimidating opening--

Daylight pours into the dark warehouse from the partly op door. Brian charges inside, then Dominic. Brian dives behind a row of pallets. Followed by Dominic. They lay flat on the concrete floor, panting.

To get a look at this place. It's full of the latest stuf everyone wants. Motorcycles. Big Screen TVs. Luxury cars and parts. VCRs and DVD players. Brian and Dominic take i the panorama before them. Not a soul in sight, except for
Bound and gagged. Eyes brimming with agony and dread. Because he is chained to the undercarriage of: (CONTINUED)
224 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 93.

Hanging from a gantry crane. It is slowly being lowered t the cement floor. 20 feet to go. With its wheels removed, Jesse will be squashed like a bug. He thrashes madly. SCREAMS into the duct tape on his face.
Trade incensed looks. Dominic points at:
Mounted to the far wall of the warehouse. A perilously exposed stretch of open floor leads to it.
Wherever Pete is, assume he's covering those controls. Dominic doesn't care. He goes for it, up and running befo Brian can stop him.
Dominic, no! Dominic running across no man's land.

Ducking out from between a row of stolen BMWs. He levels the Mac~-11 at Dominic with a sadistic grin-- KERCHACK! Brian shucks in a fresh one. Shoulders the big gun-- BRDDDDDT! Pete opens fire, his Mac firehoses lead-- Bullets tear into Big Screen TV's and motorcycles as they chase after a running Dominic. He dives between two Hurricanes.
Brian fires. Taking out a Beemer windshield.
Is hit, he jerks backwards. Disappearing between the Beemers.
Still several yards from the crane controls. Trapped. BAM BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM~BAM! He fires Brian's pistol uselessly at the shadows. CLICK -- It's empty. (CONTINUED)
224 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 94,
Stares at the cement floor a couple feet from his face.
Runs out in the open, cycles the pumpgun -- KERCHACK! Sprints towards Pete's position. He hits the ground, rolls...
Slaps home a fresh magazine. He lays on his belly, to sho under the cars at Brian. The Mac CLICKING against the cement.
Heard that, fires at the noise--
Buckshot SIZZLES under the cars. A ricochet ZINGS into Pete's shoulder.
Is up and running, towards the cars.
SEES Brian's feet running toward him.
Strafes Brian's legs. Who zigs as he runs. Bullets chasin his feet. Brian jumps onto a huge TV. Bullets chew up its base, where Brian's feet would have been.

SEES a motorcycle helmet.. He SEES the Suburban is maybe feet off the floor. Time to act. He grabs the helmet, stands and runs toward the Suburban, helmet under his arm like a football. Aiming the empty gun in Pete's direction
It's me Pete! Want me? Get me! C'mon, Pete!
Pops up like a demonic piece of toast. Aiming at Dominic-  © 225 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 95.
Runs for the controls.
Dives for the Suburban... Tosses' the helmet under the ax
Opens fire -- BRDDDDDDDDDT! Bullets shred the Suburban.
Slaps the emergency STOP button. The motorcycle under the helmet CRACKS IN TWO...
Touches cement.
Whirls on Brian... PETE'S FINGER -- Tightens on the trigger.
One hand on the stop button, the other gripping the shotg takes a one handed shot--
Jerks out of sight behind the cars as buckshot splits his chest open.

It appears to be solidly resting on the floor. On Jesse. Brian works the controls and the Suburban is suddenly lif several feet from the floor. Dominic crosses to Jesse. His head hangs limp. Then his eyes open and he begins thrashing. Very much alive. Dominic grins from ear to ear. Brian leaps onto the hood of a Beemer. SEES Pete sprawled behind it. He jumps down and kicks the Mac out of the way Pete is no threat. He's dead.
(CONTINUED)
The door. Dominic walks out, silhouetted by daylight.
EXT. TED'S WAREHOUSE — DAY 226 Brian’walks Jesse outside, an arm around his waist. Mia comes running. Brian hands him off to her.
He's okay. Call nine one one. Brian looks for Dominic. Hears a massive ENGINE STARTING.
Just let hiim go.
I can't. Brian takes off running...
Dominic's Buick disappears around a corner.
Brian hops in his Nissan, starts it and follows. cur TO:
Brian burns up the road. Dominic nowhere in sight. Brian' cell RINGS.
Hello?
Turn right on Harper.

CLICK. Brian SEES Harper street. Makes a sharp right. Then stomps his brakes -- EEEEEEEEBEEEEE! Because Dominic is right there. Stopped at a red light. Brian's Nissan stops several yards behind him. (CONTINUED)

Brian squints though his window at the Buick. Dominic extends an arm out and waves Brian forward. A beat. Then Brian puts it in first and pulls up to the Buick-- EXT. INTERSECTION — DAY 230 --stopping nose to nose above white crosswalk line. The cars, now side by side, RUMBLE with power. Dominic and Brian look at each other.
We used to drag here when in high school. Streets're laid out all precise. That light up there...
Is another RED STOPLIGHT. At a RAILROAD CROSSING.
Is exactly one quarter mile from here.
To the left, a good distance away is a FREIGHT TRAIN, mov at a good clip.
When that light turns green, I'm going for it. I'm beating that train.
Just gonna drive away from everything?

All I see here is you, (a beat) I only lost one race in my life. My first. My old man beat me bloody that night. Never lost a race since. Swear to God. Brian looks at Dominic, these two are way beyond bullshitting each other.
My dad was a cop. I knew from the day I was born I was gonna be one too. Because he told me so. They trade understanding locks. It's all kind of funny, b it isn't.
(CONTINUED)
Is getting closer. Dominic settles in his seat, because..
Is turning yellow.
You go, I go. Brian frantically sets his turbo and NOS controllers. Dominic is cool as a cucumber.
I'm going.
What are we racing for?
Freedom. Brian gives him a nod. Then two hands grab shifters -- 1s gear. Two feet on clutch pedals.
Watching, waiting for...
VROOM! The Buick is a monster, its left front wheel rises two feet off the ground as engine torque twists its chass
Lunge forward. Suddenly that train looks closer than ever
Dominic pulls ahead.

The car rockets forward. Brian ignores the gages and LISTENS to the engine. Time seems to slow as Brian finall finds that special zone... His face reflects a serenity we haven't seen before. It seems like forever as he clutches and shifts into thir Just as perfect as can be. He can almost hear each individual GEAR in the transmission. The car is SPEAKING him as none have before.  232 233 234 235 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 99.
Dominic can FEEL Brian right behind. Dominic is in the zo too as he slips the Buick into FOURTH GEAR.
A scary place to be right now because a huge train and--
--two fast cars are approaching.
The ENGINEER REACTS. Because he's about to nail two cars. He curses their stupidity as he hits the AIRHORN.

Brian focuses on getting every last foot pound of torque from his engine. Computer, car and driver have become a trinity of acceleration. The train is so close Brian can feel the RUMBLE of its diesels in his bones.
A lot of fast moving metal is coming together and it look real bad...
Are dead even. Dominic pulls ahead. Then Brian. Then Dominic again. Now over a hundred MPH.
HONKING its airhorn. Nothing can stop it.
Make eye contact. And within the molasses of time that th both occupy now, Dominic says goodbye. AND SLAMS IT IN STH .
Pulls ahead with sudden and surprising acceleration.
Realizes he can never beat Dominic. Either he can hit the brakes or... (CONTINUED)
